data.text: Every friend will say, I also am his friend:
Is there not a grief in it even unto death,
O wicked imagination, whence camest thou rolling in
There is a companion, which rejoiceth in the gladness of a friend,
There is a companion, which for the belly’s sake laboureth with his friend,
Forget not a friend in thy soul;
Every counsellor extolleth counsel;
Let thy soul beware of a counsellor,
And say unto thee, Thy way is good:
Take not counsel with one that looketh askance at thee;
Take not counsel  with a woman about her rival;
But rather be continually with a godly man,
And make the counsel of thy heart to stand;
For a man’s soul is sometime wont to bring him tidings,
And above all this intreat the Most High,
Let reason be the beginning of every work,
As a token of the changing of the heart,
four manner of things do rise up,
There is one that is shrewd and  the instructor of many,
There is one  that is subtil in words, and is hated;
For grace was not given him from the Lord;
There is one that is wise to his own soul;
A wise man will instruct his own people;
A wise man shall be filled with blessing;
The life of man is numbered by days;
The wise man shall inherit confidence among his people,
My son, prove thy soul in thy life,
For all things are not profitable for all men,
Be not insatiable in any luxury,
For in multitude of meats there shall be disease,
Because of surfeiting have many perished;
